title: Provides for the labeling of all shipments of firearms, and certain shipments of shotguns and rifles and reporting certain information
summary: Provides for the labeling of all shipments of firearms, and shipments of shotguns and rifles in jurisdictions which require a permit or license to possess a rifle or shotgun; provides for manifests for transportation thereof, notice to the superintendent of state police, transporters to know what they are transporting when reasonably possible, and for postponement of delivery pending police investigation.

    7  S 265.45 TRANSPORTATION OF RIFLES OR SHOTGUNS;  MANIFEST  AND  REPORTING
    8               REQUIRED.
    9    EVERY  PERSON  TRANSPORTING  RIFLES OR SHOTGUNS AS MERCHANDISE INTO OR
   10  WITHIN ANY JURISDICTION IN THIS STATE WHICH REQUIRES A PERMIT OR LICENSE
   11  TO PURCHASE, CARRY OR POSSESS A RIFLE OR SHOTGUN:
   12    1. SHALL NOT ACCEPT FOR SUCH  TRANSPORT  ANY  RIFLES  OR  SHOTGUNS  AS
   13  MERCHANDISE  WHERE HE OR SHE KNOWS OR HAS REASONABLE MEANS OF ASCERTAIN-
   14  ING WHAT HE OR SHE IS TRANSPORTING, UNLESS HE OR SHE CARRIES IN  HIS  OR
   15  HER POSSESSION A MANIFEST WHICH CLEARLY AND CONSPICUOUSLY SHOWS THE NAME

   23  DELIVERY AND THE SUPERINTENDENT OF STATE POLICE, OF THE NAME AND ADDRESS

   25  NUMBER, MAKE, MODEL AND MANUFACTURER'S NAME OF EACH  RIFLE  OR  SHOTGUN,
   26  THE  SERIAL  NUMBER  FOR  EACH RIFLE OR SHOTGUN SOLD OR EXCHANGED ON THE
   27  INTERNET AND INFORMATION IDENTIFYING THE INTERNET WEBSITE OF THE  SELLER
   28  OF SUCH RIFLE OR SHOTGUN;
   29    2. SHALL WITHHOLD DELIVERY TO THE CONSIGNEE FOR SUCH REASONABLE PERIOD
   30  OF  TIME DESIGNATED IN WRITING BY SUCH POLICE COMMISSIONER, POLICE CHIEF
   31  OR OTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER AND THE SUPERINTENDENT OF STATE  POLICE
   32  AS  SUCH OFFICIAL MAY DEEM NECESSARY FOR INVESTIGATION AS TO WHETHER THE
   33  CONSIGNEE MAY LAWFULLY RECEIVE AND POSSESS SUCH RIFLES OR SHOTGUNS; AND
   34    3. SHALL PRODUCE SUCH MANIFEST FOR INSPECTION  AT  THE  REQUEST  OF  A
   35  PEACE  OFFICER,  ACTING  PURSUANT TO HIS OR HER SPECIAL DUTIES, A POLICE
   36  OFFICER OR ANY OTHER PERSON AUTHORIZED BY LAW TO INQUIRE INTO OR  INVES-
   37  TIGATE THE TRANSPORTATION OF RIFLES OR SHOTGUNS.
   38    A KNOWING VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION IS A CLASS E FELONY.
   39    S 3. Section 265.00 of the penal law is amended by adding a new subdi-
   40  vision 24 to read as follows:
   41    24.  "INTERNET" MEANS THE COMBINATION OF COMPUTER FACILITIES AND ELEC-
   42  TROMAGNETIC TRANSMISSION MEDIA,  AND  RELATED  EQUIPMENT  AND  SOFTWARE,
   43  COMPRISING  THE  INTERCONNECTED  WORLDWIDE  NETWORK OF COMPUTER NETWORKS
   44  THAT EMPLOY THE TRANSMISSION CONTROL PROTOCOL/INTERNET PROTOCOL  OR  ANY
   45  SUCCESSOR PROTOCOL TO TRANSMIT INFORMATION.
   46    S 4. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   47  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
